Map shows stunning improvement in California drought

The recent storms that walloped the Sierra have significantly moved the needle on the state's stubborn drought: A large swath of California, including part of the Sierra foothills, the Central Valley and the south-central coast, is no longer classified as being in drought, according to a map released Thursday by the federal government in partnership with a university group.
